article.title: Variable stars in the Gaia era: Mira, RR Lyrae, delta and Type-II Cepheids

multiple_choice_question.text: This picture was taken in 2010 at the Royal Observatory of Belgium. What was the occasion?
choices: A celebration of Jan Cuypers\' birthday.
A meeting of astronomers not involved in Gaia.
The official launch of the Gaia mission.

multiple_choice_question.text: Which type of variable star has the largest number of period-luminosity relations based on the Gaia G band listed in the table?
According to the table, which class of variable star in the GCVS has the lowest percentage of stars with parallaxes determined in GDR1 with a relative error less than 16%?
Which RR Lyrae star in the table has the smallest relative parallax error based on GDR1 measurements?
What information, besides parallax, is provided for the Mira and SR variables listed in the table?
